hey ppl I have run out of space on my root partition, is there any way by which ... without formatting , I cud inc the space ( and yes ofcourse I have uninstalled all the useless softwares)
hey ppl I have run out of space on my root partition, is there any way by which ... without formatting , I cud inc the space ( and yes ofcourse I have uninstalled all the useless softwares)
you can move your home dir to another partition
yes, why not?
that wont mess up my existing install ??
no you have to copy de data to the new partition and then add an entry in fstab for that partition
I m quite a n00b to understand that
well i do not know how to explain it better... You copy the data that is under home/ to the new partition and then add this new partition to /etc/fstab and tell it to mount under /home.
take a look at my fstab to see what i mean i have three main partitions for my system... / /boot and /home
i found a how to in the web http://ubuntu.wordpress.com/2006/01/29/move-home-to-its-own-partition/
making this is worth if it is the files under home the ones that takes most of the space of course. du -hs /home to see
u there ??
yes
take a look at the how to i gave you... http://ubuntu.wordpress.com/2006/01/29/move-home-to-its-own-partition/
